wikipedia_page.main: Lieutenant-General Sir George Charles Gordon-Lennox  (29 May 1908 – 11 May 1988) was a senior British Army officer who served during the Second World War.

link_mentions.page: King of Arms of the Order of the British Empire
response: |Lieutenant General Sir George Gordon-Lennox, KBE, CB, CVO, DSO

link_mentions.page: List of governors of Edinburgh Castle
Index of World War II articles (G)

response: Gordon-Lennox married Evelyn, daughter of Henry Loch, 1st Baron Loch, in 1907. They had two sons, Lieutenant-General Sir George Gordon-Lennox and Rear-Admiral Sir Alexander Gordon-Lennox. Lady Bernard Gordon-Lennox remained a widow until her death in June 1944, during World War II, aged 67, when a V-1 flying bomb hit the Guards Chapel, Wellington Barracks.
